supporting_text: The NAP outlines a One Health approach that integrates human health, animal health, and environmental considerations.
The NAP includes specific strategies aimed at improving human health through better antimicrobial stewardship.
The NAP addresses animal health by implementing measures to monitor and control antimicrobial use in livestock.
The NAP includes actions to assess and mitigate the environmental impact of antimicrobial residues.
The NAP outlines strategies to promote responsible use of antimicrobials in agriculture to ensure food security.
The NAP specifies the establishment of a reporting framework to monitor progress on its objectives.
The NAP sets specific targets to be achieved by 2025.
The NAP includes quantitative targets for reducing AMR prevalence and monitoring antimicrobial use.
The NAP outlines a budget allocation for implementing its strategies against AMR.
The NAP includes an assessment of future budget needs for various AMR-related activities.
The NAP establishes a multisectoral task force to coordinate AMR efforts across sectors.
The NAP includes actions to strengthen laws and regulations governing antimicrobial use.
The NAP outlines educational initiatives aimed at increasing awareness of AMR among healthcare professionals.
The NAP includes plans for public awareness campaigns to engage communities in combating AMR.
The NAP emphasizes the importance of international collaboration with organizations like WHO and FAO.
The NAP includes strategies for developing AMR surveillance systems and data collection tools.
The NAP outlines actions to enhance capacity for detecting and reporting new resistance patterns.
The NAP includes specific strategies for improving sanitation and infection prevention measures.
The NAP commits to implementing international standards for AMR control.
The NAP includes regulations for the distribution and prescription of antibiotics.
The NAP emphasizes the need for regulations to ensure the rational use of antibiotics.
The NAP includes actions to engage in international research collaborations for new AMR solutions.
